remarks:
Define the proper substitution of a class for a set into another class. The underlined brackets distinguish it from the substitution into a wff, ~ wsbc , to prevent ambiguity.  Theorem ~ sbcel1g shows an example of how ambiguity could arise if we didn't use distinguished brackets. Theorem ~ sbccsb recreates substitution into a wff from this definition.  (Contributed by NM, 10-Nov-2005.)
